mapper.sql: ID, USER_NAME, PASS_WORD, SCH_ID, TELEPHONE, ROLE_ID, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER
mapper.insert: insert into manager (ID, USER_NAME, PASS_WORD, SCH_ID, TELEPHONE, ROLE_ID, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{passWord,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{schId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{telephone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{roleId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

mapper.update:
update manager
USER_NAME = #{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
PASS_WORD = #{passWord,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
SCH_ID = #{schId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
TELEPHONE = #{telephone,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
ROLE_ID = #{roleId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
CREATE_TIME = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
CREATE_USER = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update manager set USER_NAME = #{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, PASS_WORD = #{passWord,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, SCH_ID = #{schId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, TELEPHONE = #{telephone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, ROLE_ID = #{roleId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_TIME = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_USER = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select count(*) from manager where USER_NAME LIKE #{param}
